transformation module¶

class transformation.Transformation(df)¶

Bases: object

This class allows transforming variables in pandas dataframes and save the manipulation made for future analysis reruns.

box_cox(drop_cols=None)¶

Applies a Box-Cox transformation to data.

Returns

None

feature_select(y_df, method='ppscore', cutoff=0.1)¶

Applies feature selection to your dataframe based on various methodologies.

Parameters

  • y_df (DataFrame) – Required A pandas DataFrame with the data of the response variable.

  • method (str) – Optional; defaults to “ppscore” The method used to choose significant variables in dataset. Defaults to PPScore; else defaults to Pearson correlation.

Returns

None

normalize()¶

Applies a normalization step to data.

Returns

None

pca()¶

Applies Principal Component Analysis to data and appends variables with PC components to data.

Returns

None

standard_normal()¶

Applies a standard normal transformation to data.

Returns

None

step_rm()¶

Removes a transformation and its optional attributes appended to a dataframe.

Returns

None

transform_new(new_df)¶

Applies previously stored transformations to a brand-new DataFrame.

Parameters

new_df (DataFrame) – Required A new pandas DataFrame to apply stored transformations to.

Returns

None
